that the number of incident photons reaching K 2 Ti 6 O 13 becomes less for the hybrid catalyst, thereby reducing the number of electrons and holes available for the reaction.Therefore, the decrease in the yields of the photoreduction products, including H 2 , CH 4 , HCOOH and HCHO, over PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 is responsible for the decrease in the yields for the hybrid catalyst.Inui and coworkers 25,26 have reported that the Fe-based catalysts exhibited high catalytic reactivity for the formation of C C bond on

K 2 Ti 6 O 13 .Therefore, it is considered that the prepared hybrid catalyst can produce at least H 2 from water under UV-irradiation, as previously investigated 35. The reduction of CO 2 with water into valuable organic compounds under concentrated sunlight was investigated for the first time over a hybrid catalyst, in which a Pt-loaded K 2 Ti 6 O 13 photocatalyst was combined with a Fe-based catalyst supported on a dealuminated Y-type zeolite (Fe-Cu-KDAY).In this reaction system, the PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 catalyst decomposes water to produce H 2 and the Fe-Cu-KDAY catalyst reduces CO 2 with the resulting H 2 into organic compounds.When only the PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13

reactants.Consequently, the yields of organic compounds remarkably increased under concentrated sunlight in the present study. Comparative tests were also conducted on the reduction of CO 2 with water over the hybrid catalyst using Fe-Cu-KDAY and PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 in various weight ratios under concentrated sunlight.As discussed previously, many factors affect the intensity of the solar energy received by the catalysts, depending on experimental days, which in turn result in variations in the average

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

products were detected when the Fe-Cu-KDAY catalyst was exposed to the UV-irradiation from the Hg-lamp.It is suggested that the prepared Fe-Cu-KDAY catalyst has no photocatalytic activity for the reduction of CO 2 with water.On the contrary, the evolution of H 2 and CH 4 in the gas phase as well as HCOOH and HCHO in the liquid phase were confirmed for the PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 photocatalyst under Hg-lamp irradiation.However, when irradiated with a Xe-lamp, only the evolution of H 2 and CH 4 was observed for PtK

2 and CH 4 was observed for PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 .As considered above, this is because the prepared PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 photocatalyst has photocatalytic reactivity in the wavelength regions of 300-420 nm under Xe-lamp irradiation, and wavelengths longer than 420 nm cannot be utilized for the reaction.Note that 33,34.This may account for the reason why no detectable amount of O 2 was formed in this study.On the other hand, the yields of products decreased when the hybrid catalyst was used under both Xe-and Hg-lamp

Fig. 5 shows the variations in temperature in the reaction cell under concentrated sunlight with respect to the various experimental days noted in Table 2. Some probabilistic factors, such as wind velocity and humidity, affect the intensity of solar energy received by the cell, resulting in the fluctuation of the temperature in the cell during the experimental periods.It should be noted that the maximum temperature reached ca.600 K in October and 540 K in December.At such relatively high temperatures, the

catalyst was effective for synthesizing CH 3 OH and C 2 H 5 OH from CO 2 and water under concentrated sunlight.However, the amount of obtained organic products was low; the apparent turnover number (TON), defined as the ratio of the total amount of CH 3 OH and C 2 H 5 OH produced to that of the active site of Fe in the hybrid catalyst was 0.05 when used at 590 K for 6 h.This low TON value observed in this study must be due to the low activity of the PtK 2 Ti 6 O 13 photocatalyst for H 2 production, though
